stories.text: What and/or how a net or web tool, e.g. yt-dlp etc, that will download a media with resolution being preset, predetermined or preadjusted so downsampling it and having the far more efficient or cut-cost actual download then?
stories.title: Ask HN: A Tool to download a media by having it preadjusted

stories.text:
Hi HN,

I'm Arnav, the creator of Rune. I've been a long-time reader of newsletters.

Historically, newsletters have been about sharing a collection of links or short form content. However, with platforms like Substack and Revue becoming the preferred publishing medium for many, newsletter content has become more long-form in nature.

As a reader, Gmail, Outlook and other general purpose email clients are less than ideal interfaces for reading this such long form content, let alone remember what I read by annotating, adding notes, etc.

After grappling with this problem for a while, I decided to build Rune – a dedicated email client for reading & annotating newsletters.

Upon signing up for Rune, you'll be assigned a unique email address that you can subscribe to newsletters with or setup autoforwarding to from your email provider of choice.

TL;DR: Rune is an alternative email app for reading and annotating newsletter content.

Excited for you all to try it :)
stories.title: Show HN: Rune Reader – A dedicated email inbox for your newsletters
